content: 2 slip_stitch into the next chain-4 space which should be the one before the stitch marker chain 5 slip_stitch into the next chain-4 space after the stitch marker chain 5 and turn 1 chain-2 2 slip_stitch 1 chain-5 loop chain-5 row 2 ws ignore the slip_stitch just made slip_stitch in the next slip_stitch laying the chain-5 over the chain-5 loop from the previous row chain 3 working behind stitches from previous petal and placing stitch right next to the last slip_stitch of previous petal slip_stitch into next round 4 chain-4 space chain 1 and turn 2 slip_stitch 1 chain-3 space 1 chain-1 row 3 rs holding the two chain-5 loops together and treating them as one 11 treble_crochet into this loop slip_stitch into next round 4 chain-4 space chain 2 slip_stitch into next round 4 chain-4 space chain 1 and turn 11 treble_crochet 2 slip_stitch 1 chain-2 space 1 chain-1 row 4 ws double_crochet chain 1 into each of next 11 treble_crochet double_crochet chain 1 into chain-1 space fold previous petal towards you and work behind it slip_stitch into next round 4 chain-4 space sharing with the previous petal chain 4 and turn 12 double_crochet 12 chain-1 1 chain-4 1 slip_stitch row 5 rs single_crochet into next chain-1 space chain 4 12 times single_crochet into next chain-1 space 13 single_crochet 12 chain-4 petal 6 worked so it tucks under the first petal completing the overlapping circle row 1 as row 1 of petal 2-5 row 2 as row 2 of petal 2-5 row 3 rs holding the two chain-5 loops together and treating them as one 11 treble_crochet into this loop slip_stitch into next round 4 chain-4 space going behind first petal made stitch next to the slip_stitch from first petal chain 2 slip_stitch into next round 4 chain- 4 space still working behind first petal chain 1 and turn 11 treble_crochet 2 slip_stitch 1 chain-2 space 1 chain-1 row 4 as row 4 of petal 2-5 row 5 rs single_crochet into next chain-1 space chain 4 12 times single_crochet into next chain-1 space ch2 single_crochet into next round 4 chain-4 space behind first petal this will be the one before the next marker 13 single_crochet 12 chain-4 1 chain-2 1 slip_stitch fasten_off 2015 lettice rose cow parsley afghan square page 3 of 4 background round 5 making a foundation chain for the background this round is worked with back post stitches behind the petals into row 3 treble shell use the same colour as the petals so the stitches will be invisible the work may cup a bit on this row it will work itself flat over subsequent row however try not to chain too tightly rs counting from right attach colour b with slip_stitch to back post of 3rd treble_crochet of any petal row 3 start stitching into this same stitch then repeat in each petal round bpsc into 3rd treble_crochet chain 2 bpsc in 5th treble_crochet bpsc in 6th treble_crochet mark this stitch only on the first
